meanings.definition: Belief in the truth of something
meanings.sent1: I give you credit for being honest.
meanings.sent2: She deserves credit for telling the truth.
meanings.sent3: To be honest, I never doubted your credit.
meanings.sent4: Her reputation for honesty gives her credit in the community.
meanings.sent5: His credibility and trustworthiness earn him credit among his peers.

meanings.definition: Money received in exchange for goods or services
meanings.sent1: I used my credit to buy a new phone.
meanings.sent2: She paid with her credit card at the store.
meanings.sent3: I'm running low on credit, so I need to be careful with my spending.
meanings.sent4: His credit limit allows him to make big purchases.
meanings.sent5: The store offers discounts for customers who use credit for payment.

meanings.definition: Recognition or acknowledgment of achievement or contribution
meanings.sent1: They gave her credit for her hard work.
meanings.sent2: He received credit for his outstanding performance.
meanings.sent3: Getting credit for your efforts feels rewarding.
meanings.sent4: Her promotion was a well-deserved credit to her skills.
meanings.sent5: The team's success was a credit to their dedication and teamwork.
